cards.flavor: For hundreds of years Ugin slept, encased in the cocoon of stone and magic Sarkhan had created using a shard of a Zendikari hedron. As Ugin lay dormant, his spectral guardians kept vigil.
cards.name: Scion of Ugin
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "Wherever I walk, the ancestors walk too."
cards.name: Abzan Battle Priest
cards.text:
Outlast {W} ({W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has lifelink.

cards.flavor: The fastest way across the dunes is above.
cards.name: Abzan Falconer
cards.text:
Outlast {W} ({W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has flying.

cards.flavor: "Hold the line, for family and the fallen!"
cards.name: Ainok Bond-Kin
cards.text:
Outlast {1}{W} ({1}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has first strike.

cards.flavor:
"When one of us prospers, the pride prospers."
—Jazal Goldmane
cards.name: Ajani's Pridemate
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Ajani's Pridemate.

cards.flavor: Every tear shed is a drop of immortality.
cards.name: Angel of Mercy
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: As demons are drawn to suffering, angels are drawn to acts of benevolence.
cards.name: Angelic Accord
cards.text: At the beginning of each end step, if you gained 4 or more life this turn, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: Even the wicked have nightmares.
cards.name: Archangel of Thune
cards.text:
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: Mirrodin's deepest caverns conceal its brightest hopes.
cards.name: Auriok Champion
cards.text:
Protection from black and from red
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Austere Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Destroy all artifacts.
• Destroy all enchantments.
• Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 3 or less.
• Destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: A golden helix streaked skyward from the Helvault. A thunderous explosion shattered the silver monolith and Avacyn emerged, free from her prison at last.
cards.name: Avacyn, Angel of Hope
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, indestructible
Other permanents you control have indestructible.

cards.flavor: Although the door is flimsy and the lock pathetically small, Josuri's family never fears the night outside.
cards.name: Benevolent Ancestor
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

cards.flavor: "I carry the light of truth. Do not pity those it blinds, for they never had eyes to see."
cards.name: Blinding Mage
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor: "We are a clachan of smiths. The forge is as comfortable to us as a small fire during a cool winter's evening."
cards.name: Burrenton Forge-Tender
cards.text:
Protection from red
Sacrifice Burrenton Forge-Tender: Prevent all damage a red source of your choice would deal this turn.

cards.flavor:
"The tools of evil are mere things. And like all things, they cannot last forever."
—Song of All, canto 881
cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: He has spent years training his eyes and ears to detect the subtle signs of a dragon's approach.
cards.name: Dragon Bell Monk
cards.text:
Vigilance
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."
cards.name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
cards.text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.

cards.name: Emerge Unscathed
cards.text:
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: When the earth shudders, the sky overflows.
cards.name: Emeria Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying.

cards.name: Great Teacher's Decree
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: "I was told these were standard issue. Do I look standard to you?"
cards.name: Guard Duty
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has defender.

cards.flavor:
"May the Ancestor strengthen my hand and guide my blade."
—Nomad war prayer
cards.name: Guided Strike
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Swords, to me! We must engage their line to protect our archers and mages. Let no one fail this task!"
cards.name: Infantry Veteran
cards.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Beneath the gaze of angels, only the righteous may stand without fear.
cards.name: Iona's Judgment
cards.text: Exile target creature or enchantment.

cards.name: Path of Bravery
cards.text:
As long as your life total is greater than or equal to your starting life total, creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, you gain life equal to the number of attacking creatures.

cards.name: Pentarch Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Pentarch Ward enters the battlefield, choose a color.
When Pentarch Ward enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Pentarch Ward.

cards.name: Restoration Angel
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Restoration Angel enters the battlefield, you may exile target non-Angel creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: "I don't know where my destiny lies, but I know it isn't here."
cards.name: Seeker of the Way
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Seeker of the Way gains lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Follow the light. In its absence, follow her.
cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor: Faith in Serra is its own reward.
cards.name: Serra Ascendant
cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
As long as you have 30 or more life, Serra Ascendant gets +5/+5 and has flying.

cards.name: Stalwart Aven
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

cards.flavor: "Human enlightenment is a firefly that sparks in the night. Dragon enlightenment is a beacon that disperses all darkness."
cards.name: Student of Ojutai
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Survival Cache
cards.text:
You gain 2 life. Then if you have more life than an opponent, draw a card.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.
cards.name: Sustainer of the Realm
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The smallest seed of regret can bloom into redemption.
cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.flavor: "My scars are my sigils. I will wear them with pride long after you're gone."
cards.name: Topan Freeblade
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

cards.name: Wing Shards
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices an attacking creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

cards.flavor: The caress of the morning star frees all from the clutch of darkness.
cards.name: Yosei, the Morning Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Yosei, the Morning Star dies, target player skips their next untap step. Tap up to five target permanents that player controls.

cards.flavor: "You can come back once you've learned some manners—and figured out how to reconstitute your physical forms."
cards.name: Aetherize
cards.text: Return all attacking creatures to their owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "I knew I'd find a use for all that newt spittle!"
cards.name: Amass the Components
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Ancestral Vision
cards.text:
Suspend 4—{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {U} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
Target player draws three cards.

cards.flavor:
"Teferi snapped his fingers, and the viashino started clucking like a chicken. Silly, yes, but exactly the thing we needed to break the stifling tension."
—Jhoira, master artificer
cards.name: Bewilder
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Cephalids value the free exchange of ideas—except for the "free" part.
cards.name: Cephalid Broker
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.

cards.name: Claustrophobia
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor: "Shame we'll never see what all the fuss was about."
cards.name: Condescend
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.
cards.name: Consecrated Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.

cards.name: Cryptic Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Counter target spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Tap all creatures your opponents control.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Day of the Dragons
cards.text:
When Day of the Dragons enters the battlefield, exile all creatures you control. Then create that many 5/5 red Dragon creature tokens with flying.
When Day of the Dragons leaves the battlefield, sacrifice all Dragons you control. Then return the exiled cards to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: Everything seems a little less ferocious when it's running from a house cat.
cards.name: Diminish
cards.text: Target creature has base power and toughness 1/1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "You thought only the gods could stop you?"
cards.name: Dissolve
cards.text: Counter target spell. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Distortion Strike
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: One piercing stare usually convinces thieves to go elsewhere.
cards.name: Doorkeeper
cards.text:
Defender
{2}{U}, {T}: Target player puts the top X cards of their library into their graveyard, where X is the number of creatures with defender you control.

cards.flavor:
"Learn to see an obstacle from a new perspective. Underneath, for example."
—Chanyi, Ojutai monk
cards.name: Elusive Spellfist
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Elusive Spellfist gets +1/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Flusterstorm
cards.text:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

cards.flavor:
"The union of sea and sky makes a perfect cover."
—Talrand, sky summoner
cards.name: Fog Bank
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Fog Bank.

cards.flavor: It readily attacks much larger prey, knowing retaliation is impossible.
cards.name: Frost Lynx
cards.text: When Frost Lynx enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor:
"Violence is the food it craves. Feed it if you dare."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
cards.name: Illusory Ambusher
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Whenever Illusory Ambusher is dealt damage, draw that many cards.

cards.flavor:
"In a daze, I woke and looked upon the battlefield, where I could swear my dreams were laying waste to the enemy."
—Letter from a soldier
cards.name: Illusory Angel
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another spell this turn.
Flying

cards.flavor: In the abstract memories of the Iquati, Jace found interesting ideas to improve upon.
cards.name: Jace's Phantasm
cards.text:
Flying
Jace's Phantasm gets +4/+4 as long as an opponent has ten or more cards in their graveyard.

cards.flavor: "Where's the fun in an escape if it's not at least a little daring?"
cards.name: Jhessian Thief
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Jhessian Thief deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "It is not a goal, but a process—the process of creating the perfect Phyrexia."
cards.name: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
cards.text:
Flash
At the beginning of your end step, draw seven cards.
Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by seven.

cards.flavor: The pull of the tide star holds eternal sway.
cards.name: Keiga, the Tide Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Keiga, the Tide Star dies, gain control of target creature.

cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: Enthusiasm is no match for preparation.
cards.name: Mana Drain
cards.text: Counter target spell. At the beginning of your next main phase, add an amount of {C} equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.flavor:
"It augments anamnesis. What is so confusing about that?"
—Perisophia the philosopher
cards.name: Mnemonic Wall
cards.text:
Defender
When Mnemonic Wall enters the battlefield, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Ojutai's Breath
cards.text:
Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: Is it an amalgamation of faded memories or the projection of a half-remembered dream? Neither answer offers any comfort.
cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"Your deed cannot be undone. You, however, can be."
—Agosto, Azorius imperator
cards.name: Repeal
cards.text:
Return target nonland permanent with converted mana cost X to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Adepts of the Riverwheel Stronghold can run through rain and never get wet; masters use the raindrops as stepping stones.
cards.name: Riverwheel Aerialists
cards.text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.
cards.name: Shriekgeist
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Shriekgeist deals combat damage to a player, that player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.

cards.flavor: Ojutai's words must be translated from Draconic before his students can benefit from their wisdom.
cards.name: Skywise Teachings
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, create a 2/2 blue Djinn Monk creature token with flying.

cards.name: Sphinx of Uthuun
cards.text:
Flying
When Sphinx of Uthuun enters the battlefield, reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: To save this plane, he must forsake all others.
cards.name: Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield have flash.
Each opponent can cast spells only any time they could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor:
"As you inject the viscus vitae into the brain stem, don't let the spastic moaning bother you. It will soon become music to your ears."
—Stitcher Geralf
cards.name: Thought Scour
cards.text:
Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Rich" is a relative term.
cards.name: Windfall
cards.text: Each player discards their hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.

cards.flavor: His slaves crave death more than they desire freedom. He denies them both.
cards.name: Abyssal Persecutor
cards.text:
Flying, trample
You can't win the game and your opponents can't lose the game.

cards.flavor: Fast and lethal, with a penchant for the weak and infirm.
cards.name: Bala Ged Scorpion
cards.text: When Bala Ged Scorpion enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with power 1 or less.

cards.name: Balustrade Spy
cards.text:
Flying
When Balustrade Spy enters the battlefield, target player reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a land card, then puts those cards into their graveyard.

cards.flavor: A shadow of life chasing a husk of glory.
cards.name: Bladewing's Thrall
cards.text:
Bladewing's Thrall has flying as long as you control a Dragon.
When a Dragon enters the battlefield, you may return Bladewing's Thrall from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Bloodghast
cards.text:
Bloodghast can't block.
Bloodghast has haste as long as an opponent has 10 or less life.
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Bloodghast from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "The hardest thing is finding the right ingredients."
cards.name: Bogbrew Witch
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Search your library for a card named Festering Newt or Bubbling Cauldron, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The Crave made Kneecleaver think she was bigger than the dragon.
cards.name: Butcher's Glee
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains lifelink until end of turn. Regenerate it. (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: Sins that would be too gruesome in the light of day are made more pleasing in the dark of night.
cards.name: Child of Night
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: He's the unlife of the party.
cards.name: Dead Reveler
cards.text: Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.
cards.name: Doom Blade
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.flavor:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Eternal Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink and "Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature." (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: Its back bubbles like a witch's cauldron, and it smells just as vile.
cards.name: Festering Newt
cards.text: When Festering Newt dies, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn. That creature gets -4/-4 instead if you control a creature named Bogbrew Witch.

cards.name: Foul-Tongue Invocation
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.
Target player sacrifices a creature. If you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast this spell, you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor:
"Watch people flock to a murder scene. Then tell me we're not all a little sick in the head."
—Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue
cards.name: Grisly Spectacle
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact creature. Its controller puts a number of cards equal to that creature's power from the top of their library into their graveyard.

cards.flavor: The hymn's melody has persisted since Tourach's time, but the words changed to invoke the phobias of each listener.
cards.name: Haunting Hymn
cards.text: Target player discards two cards. If you cast this spell during your main phase, that player discards four cards instead.

cards.flavor: The promise of anguish is payment enough for services rendered.
cards.name: Indulgent Tormentor
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card unless target opponent sacrifices a creature or pays 3 life.

cards.flavor: The fall of the evening star never heralds a gentle dawn.
cards.name: Kokusho, the Evening Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Kokusho, the Evening Star dies, each opponent loses 5 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.flavor: "My summoning begins your debt, Planeswalker."
cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

cards.name: Mer-Ek Nightblade
cards.text:
Outlast {B} ({B}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature. Outlast only as a sorcery.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has deathtouch.

cards.name: Necropotence
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

cards.flavor:
"How can we wage war against ourselves? What happens when the kami of our very souls rise against us? I answer simply: We cannot. We die. There can be no victory in this war."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda
cards.name: Night of Souls' Betrayal
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1.

cards.flavor: Dragons of Silumgar's brood begin to digest their prey even before consuming it, letting their caustic breath do much of the work.
cards.name: Noxious Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Noxious Dragon dies, you may destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.

cards.flavor: His spark lost, he plots revenge upon the plane whose corrupting mana fractured his soul.
cards.name: Ob Nixilis, the Fallen
cards.text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may have target player lose 3 life. If you do, put three +1/+1 counters on Ob Nixilis, the Fallen.

cards.flavor:
"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
cards.name: Phyrexian Rager
cards.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor: Rakdos rioters paint their faces to resemble the drakes' bloodied muzzles.
cards.name: Rakdos Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"I was not convinced you had a soul until I saw it for myself."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Reave Soul
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 3 or less.

cards.flavor: Is it at the top of the food chain or the bottom?
cards.name: Rotfeaster Maggot
cards.text: When Rotfeaster Maggot enters the battlefield, exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain life equal to that card's toughness.

cards.flavor: The litany of the infernal on his flesh pulses to the beating of his dark heart.
cards.name: Rune-Scarred Demon
cards.text:
Flying
When Rune-Scarred Demon enters the battlefield, search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
cards.name: Sanguine Bond
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.

cards.name: Sheoldred, Whispering One
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: Rakdos cultists are her best customers. They never flinch at pain and are seldom good at math.
cards.name: Tavern Swindler
cards.text: {T}, Pay 3 life: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 6 life.

cards.flavor: "Any dream is a robust harvest. Still, I prefer the timeworn dreams, heavy with import, that haunt the obsessive mind."
cards.name: Thoughtseize
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. You lose 2 life.

cards.flavor: As the bounty on Massacre Girl rose, so did the number of imitators.
cards.name: Thrill-Kill Assassin
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"If it were merely lethal, that would be sufficient. The art, however, is in maximizing the suffering it causes."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Ulcerate
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. You lose 3 life.

cards.name: Virulent Swipe
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains deathtouch until end of turn.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: Even the lost and undead need a protector.
cards.name: Wight of Precinct Six
cards.text: Wight of Precinct Six gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your opponents' graveyards.

cards.flavor: What is the sound of one head snapping?
cards.name: Wrench Mind
cards.text: Target player discards two cards unless they discard an artifact card.

cards.flavor: There was no reason to pray. This was already an act of the gods.
cards.name: Anger of the Gods
cards.text: Anger of the Gods deals 3 damage to each creature. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.flavor: The shaman rattles not to inspire a battle fury but to drown out the shrieks of those fleeing the Eldrazi.
cards.name: Battle-Rattle Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have target creature get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bogardan Hellkite
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.

cards.flavor: Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids.
cards.name: Borderland Marauder
cards.text: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Charmbreaker Devils
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an instant or sorcery card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Charmbreaker Devils gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It's hard to shout "Shields up!" with a javelin in your chest.
cards.name: Coordinated Assault
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The dragon is a perfect marriage of power and the will to use it."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Crucible of Fire
cards.text: Dragon creatures you control get +3/+3.

cards.name: Draconic Roar
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may reveal a Dragon card from your hand.
Draconic Roar deals 3 damage to target creature. If you revealed a Dragon card or controlled a Dragon as you cast this spell, Draconic Roar deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.flavor: Dragon birth lairs are littered with treasure to entice the young from their eggs.
cards.name: Dragon Egg
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Dragon Egg dies, create a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying and "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Dragon Tempest
cards.text:
Whenever a creature with flying enters the battlefield under your control, it gains haste until end of turn.
Whenever a Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, it deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of Dragons you control.

cards.flavor: Atarka serving-goblins coat themselves with grease imbued with noxious herbs, hoping to discourage their ravenous masters from adding them to the meal.
cards.name: Dragonlord's Servant
cards.text: Dragon spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.
cards.name: Earth Elemental

cards.flavor: The spell fell upon the crowd like a dragon, ancient and full of death.
cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

cards.flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?
cards.name: Furnace Whelp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fury Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Remove two time counters from target permanent or suspended card.

cards.flavor: "I found a new toy. Wanna play?"
cards.name: Guttersnipe
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Hammerhand
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Hammerhand enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has haste. (It can attack and {T} no matter when it came under your control.)

cards.flavor:
"There was clearly a scream. I'm not sure if there was a mouth."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House
cards.name: Heat Ray
cards.text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.

cards.name: Hoarding Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Hoarding Dragon enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card, exile it, then shuffle your library.
When Hoarding Dragon dies, you may put the exiled card into its owner's hand.

cards.name: Keldon Halberdier
cards.text:
First strike
Suspend 4—{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {R} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

cards.name: Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker
cards.text:
Haste
{T}: Create a token that's a copy of target nonlegendary creature you control, except it has haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.
cards.name: Kiln Fiend
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Tidal forces of the blood moon wrench and buckle the land, drawing monoliths of stone and soil toward the flaming orb.
cards.name: Magus of the Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

cards.flavor: The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.
cards.name: Mark of Mutiny
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on it and untap it. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.flavor: The calligraphy of combat is written with strokes of sudden blood.
cards.name: Monastery Swiftspear
cards.text:
Haste
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: "May the worthy spend an eternity in Blessed Sleep. May the wicked find the peace of oblivion."
cards.name: Pillar of Flame
cards.text: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.flavor: "What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man."

cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Rift Bolt

cards.flavor: The course of the falling star always ends in ruin.
cards.name: Ryusei, the Falling Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Ryusei, the Falling Star dies, it deals 5 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Scourge of Valkas
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Scourge of Valkas or another Dragon enters the battlefield under your control, it deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of Dragons you control.

cards.flavor: The mask isn't meant to hide his identity. It's meant to keep the viscera out of his eyes.
cards.name: Splatter Thug
cards.text:
First strike
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.text:
Return an instant card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Thundermaw Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Thundermaw Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each creature with flying your opponents control. Tap those creatures.

cards.flavor:
"Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?"
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Tormenting Voice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
"Do you hear that, Sarkhan? The glory of the horde! I made a legend from what you abandoned."
—Zurgo, khan of the Mardu
cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: When the Mirran resistance arrived, the furnace dwellers looked to Urabrask for guidance. His decree stunned the others: "Let them be."
cards.name: Urabrask the Hidden
cards.text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor:
"Zendikar fortifies itself against the Great Threat, making sentries of sky, sea, and stone."
—The War Diaries
cards.name: Vent Sentinel

Defender
{1}{R}, {T}: Vent Sentinel deals damage to target player or planeswalker equal to the number of creatures with defender you control.

cards.flavor: In the towering trees of the Samok Stand and the predators that guard them, the might of the Ravnican wild has returned.
cards.name: Aerial Predation
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Assault Formation
cards.text:
Each creature you control assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.
{G}: Target creature with defender can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
{2}{G}: Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: So-called "old wood" is rare in deforested Ravnica. Statues carved from it are said to house the last of the ancient nature spirits.
cards.name: Carven Caryatid
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Carven Caryatid enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: To some mages, the meaning of life is less important than how much is left.
cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C}.

cards.flavor: The best way to calm a rampaging ceratok is to wait until it dies of natural causes.
cards.name: Crowned Ceratok
cards.text:
Trample
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.

cards.flavor:
"Hunters feed on the fear of their prey."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

Enchant player

cards.name: Durkwood Baloth

cards.flavor:
"Last time, it tore up the Wilt-Leaf, turned Mistmeadow into a mudhole, and made the river jump its banks. On the bright side, we were eating venison for weeks."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer
cards.name: Duskdale Wurm
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

cards.flavor: For Mittens, it was just another day at the beach.
cards.name: Enlarge
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 and gains trample until end of turn. It must be blocked this turn if able. (If a creature with trample would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

cards.name: Genesis Hydra
cards.text:
When you cast this spell, reveal the top X cards of your library. You may put a nonland permanent card with converted mana cost X or less from among them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle the rest into your library.
Genesis Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Genesis Wave
cards.text: Reveal the top X cards of your library. You may put any number of permanent cards with converted mana cost X or less from among them onto the battlefield. Then put all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Bone, stone . . . both taste the same to a hungry basilisk.
cards.name: Greater Basilisk
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: Travelers' tales claim that hydras bite off their own heads to make themselves deadlier.

cards.text:
Heroes' Bane enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}{G}{G}: Put X +1/+1 counters on Heroes' Bane, where X is its power.

cards.flavor: Dragons scorn the weak, even among their own kind.

cards.name: Hunting Pack
cards.text:
Create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

cards.flavor: "Now is the hour. Ours is the duty. For victory and family—charge!"
cards.name: Inspiring Call
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it. Those creatures gain indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: In the gardens of the centaurs, many travelers have mysteriously vanished while admiring the elaborate topiaries.

cards.text: Ivy Elemental enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: On Murasa, even the trees grow trees.

Defender

cards.flavor: The light of the rising star empowers the champions of tomorrow.

cards.text:
Flying
When Jugan, the Rising Star dies, you may distribute five +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Lead the Stampede
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: Its scales contain the essence of thousands of lotus blooms.

cards.text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may add one mana of any color.

cards.flavor: It makes the insignificant conspicuous, the repulsive alluring, and the deadly irresistible.

Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.flavor:
"The timeless, tireless jaws of nature shall one day devour us all."
—Sildark, artificer of Omu

cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Its controller gains 4 life.

cards.flavor: It is an expert at culling individuals who stray too far from the herd.

Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:
"Our enemy is nothing less than the end of all life. We shall not want for allies."
—The War Diaries

Defender
{T}: Add {G} for each creature with defender you control.

cards.name: Phantom Tiger

cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: When nature calls, run.

cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Primeval Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may search your library for up to two land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"When the land is angry, so are they."
—Nissa Revane

Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.

cards.text:

cards.flavor: "You can have the body, necromancer. I just want the skin."
cards.name: Sultai Flayer
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control with toughness 4 or greater dies, you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: "Can you build a fire? Track a deer? Identify killer trees? Then you'll never survive Kessig without me."

cards.text: When Timberland Guide enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana of any type that land produced.
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, that land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

"Mana grows and changes like the roots of a plant. Like a plant, it must be nurtured."
—Nissa Revane
cards.name: Wall of Roots

Defender

cards.flavor: Two times the size, four times the smell.

cards.flavor: She paints pictures with words, though not all pictures show the truth.

cards.flavor: Weakness is not in the nature of the Swarm.

cards.flavor: The Izzet learn something from every lesson they teach.

Draw a card.

cards.name: Firemane Angel

Flying, first strike

{6}{R}{R}{W}{W}: Return Firemane Angel from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.flavor:
"I am confident that if anyone actually penetrates our facades, even the most perceptive would still be fundamentally unprepared for the truth of House Dimir."
—Szadek
cards.name: Glimpse the Unthinkable

cards.flavor:
"Even this primitive specimen of my kind is impressive."
—Niv-Mizzet

Flying, haste

cards.flavor: Within silent clearings guarded by living palisades, the natural world guards its most precious secrets.

cards.flavor:
"Knowledge of Bant's landscape and ruins is a weapon that the invaders can't comprehend."

cards.flavor:
"Rage is not the answer. Rage followed by fitting vengeance is the answer."
—Ajani Goldmane

cards.flavor: A demon cannot be trusted, and a dragon will not be ruled.
cards.name: Malfegor

Flying

cards.flavor: Night after night, Rosheen babbled about a bygone sunlit world, her every word dismissed as a madwoman's ravings.

cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}{C}. Spend this mana only on costs that contain {X}.

Double strike

cards.flavor:

—Momir Vig

cards.flavor: Leonos had no second thoughts about the abolishment edict. He'd left skyrunes warning of the eviction, even though it was cloudy.

cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.

cards.name: Vizkopa Guildmage
cards.text:

cards.name: Bubbling Cauldron
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: Heavier than it looks, tricky to wield, guaranteed to last.

cards.flavor: The idols were forged during the time of the Khanfall, when the dragons came to rule Tarkir and its people aligned themselves with the five dragonlords.
cards.name: Dragonloft Idol

cards.name: Guardian Idol
cards.text:
Guardian Idol enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: Kolaghan has no lasting home, but her disciples leave relics to mark her conquests.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
{4}{B}{R}: Kolaghan Monument becomes a 4/4 black and red Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Each night, the artificer tucked the little doll into a locked drawer. Each morning, she awoke to find it waiting beside her with some new bauble."
—"The Artificer's Apprentice"
cards.name: Manakin
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}.

cards.flavor:
"What is mana but possibility, an idea not yet given form?"
—Jhoira, master artificer
cards.name: Mind Stone

cards.flavor:
"Let go of your memories and be reborn."
—Argent Etchings, plate 106, passage 27

cards.flavor:
"Arcum is a babbling fool! Phyrexian technology is our greatest blessing. Take this delightful trinket for instance . . ."
—Heidar, Rimewind master
cards.name: Mishra's Bauble
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Bauble: Look at the top card of target player's library. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.flavor: Diluted, moonglove can etch living tissue. Concentrated, a drop will kill a giant.

cards.name: Oblivion Stone
cards.text:
{4}, {T}: Put a fate counter on target permanent.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Oblivion Stone: Destroy each nonland permanent without a fate counter on it, then remove all fate counters from all permanents.

cards.flavor: The myr are like the Glimmervoid: blank canvases on which to build grand creations.
cards.name: Palladium Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.

cards.flavor:
"Tools and artisans can be destroyed, but the act of creation is inviolate."
—Elspeth Tirel
cards.name: Pristine Talisman

cards.flavor: Scholars had puzzled for centuries over the ruins at Tal Terig. Its secrets had always lived within one rune-carved head.

cards.name: Sandstone Oracle

Flying
When Sandstone Oracle enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. If that player has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.

cards.name: Serum Powder
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Any time you could mulligan and Serum Powder is in your hand, you may exile all the cards from your hand, then draw that many cards. (You can do this in addition to taking mulligans.)

cards.name: Trepanation Blade
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, defending player reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a land card. The creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each card revealed this way. That player puts the revealed cards into their graveyard.
